Class Monster

java.lang.Object
  Monster
All Implemented Interfaces:
Item
Direct Known Subclasses:
BoltMonster, JuggernautMonster
public class Monster
extends java.lang.Object
implements Item

A Monster is an Item that moves in its row and attacks opponents. It has the ability of dealing damage to an opposing Player.

Author:
Ayush Mehra, Vincent Yang

Constructor Detail

Monster

public Monster(Player playerOneOrTwo,
               Player opponent,
               java.awt.Image[] animationImagesArray,
               java.awt.Image[] fightingImagesArray,
               int row)
Constructs a new default Monster.

Parameters:
playerOneOrTwo - the Player who owns this Monster.
opponent - the Player who is against the Player who owns this Monster.
animationImagesArray - the set of images that represent this Monster when in its normal state.
fightingImagesArray - the set of images that represent this Monster when it is fighting.
row - the row in which this Monster resides.

encounterObstacle

public void encounterObstacle(Obstacle obstacle)
equivalent to the act() method in GridWorld Each Monster can only deal damage to one opponent at a time. However, each Monster may take damage from multiple opponents simultaneously
